contextId.information: The word "you" is plural and refers to the man and the woman. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: You may not ... nor may you ... you will die

contextId.information: These words refer to the man and the woman and so are dual or plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
In verses 9 and 11, God was speaking to the man. Languages that have a singular form of "you" would use that here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Abraham is speaking to one of the men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Abraham speaks to all three of the men, so "you" and "your" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" refers to the servant and those traveling with him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here the word "you" refers to Abraham's servant. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is singular and refers to Jacob. But the blessing would also apply to Jacob's descendants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here these pronouns are singular and refer to Jacob. But the blessing also applies to Jacob's descendants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The word "you" here refers to both Rachel and Leah. It also adds emphasis. AT: "You yourselves know that I have served your father with all my strength" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: You know that it is with all my strength that I have served your father

contextId.information: The word "you" is plural and refers to everyone with Jacob. AT: "I have enough people with me to harm all of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: It is in my power to do you harm

contextId.information: Here "you" is plural and refers to Jacob's older sons. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "you" is singular and refers to Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "You" is plural and refers to the brothers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

Here "you" is singular and refers to Jacob. This "you" also stands for Israel's descendants that will become a large nation. AT: "I will give you many descendants, and they will become a great nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: I will make you a great nation

contextId.information: The promise was made to Jacob, but the promise would be fulfilled to all of Israel's descendants. AT: "I will surely bring your descendants out of Egypt again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: I will surely bring you up again

contextId.information: Here "you" and "your" are plural and refer to all the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: will be with you ... bring you back ... your fathers
